title: So since Kalista is going to be 100% immune to melee champions
body:
Just take a guess what lane she'll be abused in. 

I like how Riot isn't even trying to hide it either, clip in Spotlight where Shyvana loses 3/4 health without even touching Kalista and Kalista didn't even have a red buff lol. 

Seriously how did this go through testing? This would be like a melee champion's passive being "Takes 100% reduced damage from ranged autoattacks" 

But I digress, Riot always avoids threads that calls out their blatant ranged bias

Having played her extensively on the PBE, I can assure you her auto attack animation at lvl 1 is INSANELY slow, and her dash is quite short.

With high attack speed and full boots she can jump around yes, but early game she's easy prey for the melee'est of champions.

Even late game with perfect mechanics, she doesn't move much faster than a vayne doing the same thing, since her auto attacks root her until they're done. In the end it evens out, but just changes her movement from run->run to stop->dash->stop->dash.

Thank CertainlyT for his release abominations.  He shouldn't have a job anymore, he has no idea what balance is.
As much as I think it's tasteless to bash a certain Rioter, history hasn't proven well for him.  All 5 champions that he has released have been little more than a project to keep Morello busy.

I was one of the few people that defended RiotScruffy after the Skarner and Rengar reworks, yet I can't find it in myself to defend, or even sympathize with, CertainlyT.  He's repeatedly shown himself incapable of adding champs to the game that make the game fun for everyone involved and don't ridiculously unbalance it at the same time.  Every champ he's made requires ridiculously hard nerfs just to make it fair to play against them, and even then they're still pretty strong afterwards.
They probly judge the success of a new champion buy how mich it gets played :/
I don't think he actually balances the champs he makes...

This is true, but he doesn't consider how op the kit is.  The numbers are put in based on projections based on the surroundings.  He obviously don't use such philosophy when making kits and instead continues to push them forward to make other champs obscure.

Well I'm pretty sure it goes through the balance team, who could have easily denied something they thought was too op. It's not fair for him to get the entire blame. His job is to create unique and cool champion kits (which he does), not to make sure they're balanced. Saying that he should lose his job is going to far.

I think he's a genius, he makes amazingly designed champions. What they need to do is take his ideas and SPLIT the champion concept in to two different things. Kalista? Could have been made into an amazing tank-support with her W and R being the focus of their kits, utilizing teamplay and whatnot. The other half of Kalistas kit could have been made into another spear throwing, rending champion focusing on the mobility passive, Q and E. 

I just don't see why Riot lets him create full champions, all of her abilities have passives. There's absolutely no reason for that and that's what makes his champions too strong, they're just too overloaded. Look at Zed, why does his W give him bonus AD? Nobody knows... Yasuo? There's just too much to even list, the AS scaling on Q, W passive, Ult giving him his passive and all that free armor pen. Just flat out dumb. 

Like I said, I love CertainlyTs ideas, all of the champions he has made are amazingly fun and unique. It's just that his ideas are too big, too much for one character. They really should start splitting his ideas into multiple champions, it's a win-win situation. They'll be easier to balance, less complaining from the playerbase and they have more champions to release!

I blame him because he consistently releases OP champs that quite obviously lack balancing in the slightest.  Not every champ ever released was OP, yet almost every single CertainlyT champ has been OP on release.  Coincidence?  I think not.

I'm not saying he should be fired, just that he doesn't know what he's doing, and since Riot is supposed to employ people who *do*, I personally don't think he should have a job with Riot, or at least be moved somewhere where he can't ruin the balance of the game.

I think it's quite the opposite. CertainlyT knows EXACTLY what he's doing, much more so than the designers of other champions. Think about it; have any one of his champions ever been boring to play? Are their kits simple? Ordinary? Mundane? No they're not, they're wildly creative, interesting, and incredibly fun. 

And he doesn't really have much do with balancing anyway, thats Morello's job. He merely designs the kits, he has very little to do with the actual numbers.

Most of the CertainlyT champs I've seen are released with overstuffed kits and too-high numbers.  The kits seem to be left the same, but in return the numbers are heavily nerfed, which doesn't really fix the problems inherent in the champ's design.  You can't design a champ and have no concept of game balance, it just doesn't work.

A champion can be fun without being overwhelmingly overloaded with stuff. Yasuo could still be fun and Yasuo if he didn't get the double crit chance. If his Q didn't scale off of attack speed, etc.

For example, look at Vel'Koz I personally think he's amazingly designed. Plenty of counterplay and very little amount of overloaded BS in his abilities. They're easy to understand, easy to use. Good design. Meanwhile CertainlyT champions are very hard to figure out. Zed? If you didn't research or play Zed before playing him you wouldn't know his W gives him free AD, that his E costs less (Or refunds?) energy if he hits a champion, etc. CertainlyT champions have TONS of free stats and weird passives that make them extremely hard to balance and whatnot.

So, yeah she's just been released.  Played both with her and against her in 7 games.

Turned out you were all crazy lol.  She's not at all impossible to catch.  Her typical escape is she will try to hit you and use the slow.

I didn't have any trouble catching her on any champ I was using.  Played xin shao and warwick and diana.  Even when I had to actually catch her I used either the speed boost on tri force or the active on botrk.

The only actual annoying issue with her is if you are killing her supp she can ulti the supp to save them from certain death.  Which IMO seems kind of unfair since there's no counterplay to it.  Doesn't even need to be channeled.

Everything else about her though... yeah she's just a regular adc with some extra utility.  Think vayne with moving wards.  Also those wards don't actually spot you unless you are facing their vision radius from what I've noticed so far.

"Think vayne with a no cooldown tumble" is more like it. You're forgetting that every adc has SOME small cooldown on mobility.  They also have mana costs (Not huge but still). Kalista's E stacking is horrid too; at level 1 she can really out-trade any other adc; and the best part is, is that she's the most mobile adc with some of the better CC/survivabilty. 


Also the champions you listed have a (slow/snare/point to click CC) Try landing a leona ulti dead on when she's jumping around. Or try landing a rengar bola strike when she's jumping around. So what you're saying here is that she needs to be either counter picked by other lanes except bot lane?

Really... this is your argument.  Ok first she doesn't move as far as a dash and what no one on here mentions it's always after her attack.  If she's mid attack she isn't moving.  So she already has a motion delay even if she starts moving afterwards and it's not that far.  Vaynes tumble is better than kalista's "hop" in range.

Also, warwick does not have a slow, just used his blood scent ability.  Even if I listed other champs though there were plenty of other people in game who had no trouble with her either.  Almost every melee champ has a gap closer.  She got shredded by our yi during one game.

Strange as well that you go for rengar bolas strike as an example, as you have two gap closing options on him that only require bushes and his ulti gives him full energy for a stun bolas at point blank range which makes all this chasing discussion pretty irrelevant.

If you don't believe me go play against her in game.  It's not really a problem.  By need to counter pick it's the same as saying any champion that can blow her up or any melee champion with a gap closer ever (which leaves out like.. what.. morde?).

The issue I found is that landing skillshots on her is retardedly difficult; the comparison of vayne-tumble-without-cd is probably the best summary I can think of. Keep in mind she's an ADC. Most of the balancing issues I'm seeing are in the laning phase. Outside of that, her kit is fine, if anything a little difficult to work. It's the early game, where the above champions that counter her are all top lane or jungling and the only ones facing her are another ADC and a support that she dominates way too much.

Also, any moron can land a skillshot on anyone at point blank range, the issue is using them a little further out than that.

She's going to break the game. Every match is going to be Kalista Top or ADC and no melee is ever going to touch her due to her constant leaping.

They need to change that passive. ADCs are supposed to deal huge damage, but are also supposed to die quickly when targeted. 75% of champions will probably have a hell of a time hitting even a Bronze 5 Kalista, let alone when somebody gets her to challenger.

On one hand if you're ranked you can usually just pick a counter, but on the other hand a lot of people play normals and you can't choose a counter if you can't see what the enemy picked. She's going to have like a 70% win rate if she's released as she is now.
